results.title: AI trends shaping healthcare in 2026: agentic, physical & sovereign AI
results.content:
### Early predictions for 2026

 Greater regulatory scrutiny. Organizations should expect continued expansion of data privacy and AI governance requirements globally.
 Growing demand for compliant solutions. Multi-cloud and edge strategies will become more common as teams localize data and compute.
 Emergence of regional AI hubs. Governments and regions are likely to invest in local ecosystems to reduce reliance on external providers.

## What AI trends in 2026 mean for healthcare leaders

Agentic AI, physical AI and sovereign AI signal a shift in how artificial intelligence will be used across healthcare and life sciences. AI is taking on more responsibility, moving closer to real-world operations and operating under stricter expectations for transparency, control and compliance. [...] ### Early predictions for 2026

 Pilots move into production. As new agentic solutions mature, adoption is likely to expand beyond experimental use cases.
 Governance takes a stance. Autonomous systems raise new questions around accountability, validation and oversight that organizations can no longer defer.
 New roles emerge. Expect increased investment in upskilling, including teams focused on monitoring, training and governing AI agents.

## Physical AI and its impact on real-world healthcare operations [...] As data volumes grow and decision cycles shorten, organizations need AI that accelerates insight while operating within strict privacy and governance guardrails. Below, we explore how agentic AI, physical AI and sovereign AI are evolving and what early signals suggest as we look toward 2026.

## Agentic AI in healthcare: from pilots to real-world analytics

Agentic AI refers to autonomous systems that can plan, adapt and act across multi-step processes. Instead of supporting a single task, these agents can collaborate with other agents and with humans to move work forward.

results.title: Three new AI breakthroughs shaping 2026: AI trends | Deloitte US
results.content:
Perspective

18 Jul 2025

8 minute read

Stay in the know: AI trends and early predictions for 2026

Three forces shaping the future of AI

_Explore three AI focus areas for 2025 â€”agentic AI, physical AI, and sovereign AI. Learn why they matter and what experts predict for the near future._

Are you keeping up with the latest AI trends? Artificial intelligence is advancing at an astonishing speed. Itâ€™s hard to keep pace with all the new variations and frameworks that will reshape industries, economies, and daily life. Among the most influential trends driving innovation and disruption are agentic AI, physical AI, and sovereign AI. Each presents new opportunities and challenges for organizations and individuals. [...] These surveys reflect excitement and enthusiasm about agentic AI and physical AI and recognize the importance of sovereign AI to strategic planning. Increased efficiency, productivity, and innovation are among the likely results of these trends along with more robust guardrails to safeguard data and its usage worldwide. Weâ€™ll continue to monitor these and other emerging trends to share updated predictions for the coming year in future posts.

Want to learn more?

To find out the latest research, market trends, and viewpoints on innovative technologies that are shaping our future, subscribe to the Deloitte AI Institute newsletter and follow the AI Institutefor future blog posts in this series.

### Get in touch

Image 12: Vivek Kulkarni

#### Beena Ammanath [...] Three early predictions for 2026

1.Scaling pilots to production: Agentic AI will likely move beyond pilot projects and become more widely adopted across industries, especially among larger organizations equipped with the necessary capital and talent. The exploding market of â€œout-of-the boxâ€ agentic solutions for common use cases will expand usage of agents to more industries.

2. Increased focus on governance and compliance:Organizations will have to prioritize and implement well-defined governance frameworks and usage guidelines to address the unique considerations and risks of autonomous agents.

results.title: Agentic AI Takes Over â€” 11 Shocking 2026 Predictions - Forbes
results.content:
3. Physical AI Pilots Transform Manufacturing and Beyond

Skilled labor shortages have become structural. Pipe fitters, technicians and experienced operators are in short supply worldwide. In 2026, manufacturers will turn to AI not just to save costs but to survive.

AI will augment skilled workers by automating repetitive tasks, improving safety outcomes, optimizing supply chains and personalizing training at scale. Companies that embrace AI-driven productivity will dominate production and cost efficiency. Those that do not will fall behind quickly. [...] While many industries struggle to quantify AI returns, manufacturing offers controlled environments where results can be proven with complex numbers. Defect rates will drop, production will increase and cycle times will shrink. The industry will shift from pilots and experimentation to enterprise-wide, real-world production.

But AI will not be limited to algorithms and screens; it will also be on the production floor in the form of humanoid robotics. Nvidiaâ€™s Jensen Huang calls this the age of physical AI. Humanoid robots will transition from demonstrations to targeted commercial pilots in warehouses and factories (with leaders like Tesla, Figure and Agility aiming for thousands to tens of thousands of units), augmenting workers in controlled environments while proving safety and ROI. [...] 5. Agentic AI Runs Logistics and Production

In 2026, agentic AI will manage logistics and production end-to-end. AI agents will reroute inventory in real time, expedite shipments, allocate maintenance resources and dynamically adjust manufacturing based on need. Businesses that adopt agentic systems early will gain structural operational advantages over competitors.

6. Amazon Reemerges as an AI Infrastructure Leader

After a period of relative underperformance, Amazon will reassert itself in 2026 as AWS reaccelerates. Compute bottlenecks will fade, Trainium chips will see real enterprise adoption and AWS growth will reaccelerate to high-teens or low-20s percentages, driven by Trainium adoption and easing capacity constraints.
results.summary: Humanoid robots will transition from demonstrations to targeted commercial pilots in warehouses and factories (with leaders like Tesla, Figure and Agility aiming for thousands to tens of thousands of units), augmenting workers in controlled environments while proving safety and ROI. results.title: Five Trends in AI and Data Science for 2026
results.content:
Image 14

Carolyn Geason-Beissel/MIT SMR | Getty Images

Summary:
MIT SMR columnists Thomas H. Davenport and Randy Bean see five AI trends to pay attention to in 2026: deflation of the AI ... bubble and subsequent hits to the economy; growth of the â€œfactoryâ€ infrastructure for all-in AI adapters; greater focus on generative AI as an organizational resource rather than an individual one; continued progression toward value from agentic AI, despite the hype; and ongoing questions around who should manage data and AI.

Read More + [...] Last year, like virtually everyone else, we predicted that agentic AI would be on the rise. Although we acknowledged that the technology was being hyped and had some challenges, we underestimated the degree of both. Agents turned out to be the most-hyped trend since, well, generative AI. GenAI now resides in the Gartner trough of disillusionment, which we predict agents will fall into in 2026. [...] Here are the emerging 2026 AI trends that leaders should understand and be prepared to act on.

### 1. The AI bubble will deflate, and the economy will suffer.

Last year, the elephant in the AI room was the rise of agentic AI (and itâ€™s still clomping around; see below). This year, itâ€™s the AI bubble that has monopolized discussion: Is there one? If so, when will it burst? Will the money rush out quickly or slowly? And what are the implications for the broader economy and the ongoing use of AI?
results.summary: bubble and subsequent hits to the economy; growth of the â€œfactoryâ€ infrastructure for all-in AI adapters; greater focus on generative AI as an organizational resource rather than an individual one; continued progression toward value from agentic AI, despite the hype; and ongoing questions around who should manage data and AI. Last year, the elephant in the AI room was the rise of agentic AI (and i

results.title: 7 Agentic AI Trends to Watch in 2026 - MachineLearningMastery.com
results.content:
7 Agentic AI Trends to Watch in 2026  
Image by Author

The agentic AI field is moving from experimental prototypes to production-ready autonomous systems. Industry analysts project the market will surge from $7.8 billion today to over \$52 billion by 2030, while Gartner predicts that 40% of enterprise applications will embed AI agents by the end of 2026, up from less than 5% in 2025. This growth isnâ€™t only about deploying more agents. Itâ€™s about different architectures, protocols, and business models that are reshaping how we build and deploy AI systems. [...] ## Navigating the Agentic Transition

The trends shaping 2026 represent more than incremental improvements. They signal a restructuring of how we build, deploy, and govern AI systems. The organizations that will thrive are those that recognize agentic AI isnâ€™t about smarter automation. Itâ€™s about new architectures (multi-agent orchestration), new standards (MCP/A2A protocols), new economics (FinOps for agents), and new organizational capabilities (governance maturity, workflow redesign).

For machine learning practitioners, the path forward is clear: [...] The agentic AI field is going through its microservices revolution. Just as monolithic applications gave way to distributed service architectures, single all-purpose agents are being replaced by orchestrated teams of specialized agents. Gartner reported a staggering 1,445% surge in multi-agent system inquiries from Q1 2024 to Q2 2025, signaling a shift in how systems are designed.

Rather than deploying one large LLM to handle everything, leading organizations are implementing â€œpuppeteerâ€ orchestrators that coordinate specialist agents. A researcher agent gathers information, a coder agent implements solutions, an analyst agent validates results. This pattern mirrors how human teams operate, with each agent fine-tuned for specific capabilities rather than being a jack-of-all-trades.
results.summary: 7 Agentic AI Trends to Watch in 2026 Image by Author The agentic AI field is moving from experimental prototypes to production-ready autonomous systems. Industry analysts project the market will surge from $7.8 billion today to over \$52 billion by 2030, while Gartner predicts that 40% of enterprise applications will embed AI agents by the end of 2026, up from less than 5% in 2025.

Many of these Agentic AI examples rely on Function Calling, a feature that enables LLMs to interact with external tools and APIs in a structured way. This allows models to:

 Make API calls
 Query databases
 Execute code
 Access external knowledge

To enable Function Calling in Red Hat AI, follow this guide.

results.title: Veracity AI Talks Ep. 4: Where can industrial AI be held ...
results.content:
# Veracity AI Talks Ep. 4: Where can industrial AI be held accountable?
## DNV
5630 subscribers

### Description
34 views
Posted: 7 Aug 2025
In this latest episode of Veracity AI Talks, Managing Director Mikkel Skou joins Global Head of Engineering Tom Erik TjÃ¸nneland to explore how AI can be deployed responsibly across industrial value chains. Tune in as they discuss not only where industrial AI can be held accountable and why trusted data is a critical foundation, but also delve into DNVâ€™s approach to AI assurance, the role of Veracity and trusted data, the use of synthetic data to simulate high-risk events, and the intersection of regulation and innovation. [...] Welcome back to Veracity AI Talks. I'm your host Tom Erik SjÃ¸nn and today we're diving into one of the most important conversations happening across industries right now. The role of AI in an industrial transformation and more importantly how we can trust it. Joining me today is Mikkel Skau managing director of Veracity and we will explore how trusted data and AI assurance are becoming critical foundations for the future of industries like maritime and energy. Mikkel, welcome to the show. >> Thank you to Erik. >> Let's get right into it. Everybody talking about AI in an industrial context. There is a lot of hype out hype out there. Eh where does whereas it stand in all of this? SÃ¥ as I see it, eh AI is not an option. >> Mhm. >> Eh all companies including ours are are using AI today to [...] behave. >> Mhm. Very good. Eh, Mikkel, any last words? Eh yes I would like to see more industry collaboration on using AI in in valy chains especially on the use cases where we decarbonize the industry. >> So we we are very open to to partners and players that want to collaborate on this. >> Mhm. Very good. An invitation to all partners and customers. Thank you Mikkel for such a great conversation. It is clear that as AI becomes more embedded in the industry, trust and accountability will be just as important as innovation. That's the future that Veracity is helping us to shape. Thanks to our audience for joining us on Veracity AI talks. I'm Tom Erik SjÃ¸nnland. Until next time, stay curious and stay critical.

results.title: AWS re:Invent 2025 - Implement Agentic AI at the edge for ...
results.content:
### Description
9210 views
Posted: 2 Dec 2025
Manufacturing and industrial operations demand real-time, intelligent decision-making in low-connectivity environments. This code talk demonstrates how to deploy SmolVLMs (small vision language models) and AI agents to automate site operations using AWS Outposts and Strands Agents. The solution enables on-premises, multilingual interaction with safety protocols, documentation, and equipment data to enhance the productivity and safety of frontline workers. Youâ€™ll learn how to combine edge infrastructure, publicly available models, and agent frameworks to deliver context-aware, resilient AI for industrial automation.

Learn more:

and the right partners. And the whole thing is connected by data, valuable industrial data and all in one place. In our Siemens accelerator marketplace. So let's have a look at these elements
one by one. And let's start [...] Key Announcements & Highlights:
 Siemens & @NVIDIA Partnership: Roland Busch and Jensen Huang discuss the expansion of their partnership to build the "Industrial AI Operating System." Learn how they are closing the gap between ideas and reality by integrating AI-native engineering and "active intelligence."
 Introducing Digital Twin Composer: A new tool available mid-2026 to power the industrial metaverse at scale.
 Real-World Impact: Athina Kanioura shares how @PepsiCo is using Siemens Digital Twin Composer to simulate and upgrade facilities with 90% issue detection before physical implementation.
 Siemens & @Microsoft: Jay Parikh joins the stage to discuss bridging IT and OT, highlighting the launch of 9 new Industrial Copilots designed to streamline manufacturing and operations. [...] In this keynote, discover how Siemens is combining the real and digital worlds to accelerate innovation, resilience, and sustainability. From a massive expansion of the NVIDIA partnership to the launch of the Digital Twin Composer, see how AI is moving from "feature" to "force" across the entire industrial value chain.

Nvidia and Siemens announced plans to build an industrial AI operating system together. CEOs Jensen Huang and Roland Busch speak to Ed Ludlow about this partnership, the need for energy, Nvidia's new chips, China and Siemen's potential deals in the operations software space. They sit down at the Consumer Electronics Show.

results.title: From hype to impact: Applying AI where it matters in ...
results.content:
Showcasing the EPIQ-M industrial use cases framework (E=Energy, P=Productivity, I=Inventory, Q=Quality, M=Maintenance), this session offers a proven roadmap for identifying high-value use cases, building trust in AI technology adoption, and achieving tangible improvements in efficiency, quality, and reliability.

What you will learn:

- How to identify the right use cases for AI that deliver ROI in industrial operations
- Practical examples of how AI has improved energy efficiency, productivity, inventory optimization, quality control, and predictive maintenance
- Lessons from 12 years of applied industrial AI experience, including common pitfalls to avoid
- A framework (EPIQ-M) for aligning AI initiatives with strategic business outcomes

Learn more:
